tables.questionText: You said your reason for having a drink in the past week was best described as [pipe: S10a lower]. More specifically, what best describes that moment?

rows.label: A drink to bring everyone together at the start of the night
Something to sip while catching up with friends
A drink that feels appropriate for the situation at a social gathering
A go-to choice for reconnecting with someone after time apart
A drink that makes me feel confident and put-together in social settings
Something that looks elevated or premium when served
A drink that feels on-trend or buzzworthy
A drink I'd be proud to post or share on social media
A drink I've never tried before that sparks curiosity
A limited-edition or seasonal release I want to experience before it's gone
A drink that transports me somewhere new—culturally or emotionally
A drink to toast a personal win or milestone
Something festive to share when good news hits
A way to make an ordinary day or night feel a little more special
A drink I reach for when I just want what I want
A drink to help me unwind after a long or stressful day
Something I reach for when I need a mental reset
A drink that helps me slow down and be present
A go-to when I want to escape the usual and feel transported
A drink that helps me feel confident and socially on-point for a night out
Something I choose when I want to bring my A-game to socialize
A go-to when I want to stay in control and keep the night flowing smoothly
A drink that's always part of our holiday or seasonal celebrations
Something I serve because it's what we've always had at family gatherings
A drink that helps keep a cultural or regional tradition alive
Something I choose because it reminds me of home or loved ones
A drink that feels like I'm treating myself

changes: tableId: s1, action: labels/nets, description: Found S1 in SCREENER (Sensitive Industries). Replaced generic row labels with exact survey answer text; added a multi-variable NET (_NET_S1_AnyIndustry) aggregating items S1r1–S1r7 so analysts can see 'Any listed industry' vs 'None'. Marked the three terminate options in their labels and added a user note indicating this is a select-all question and that options 1–3 were programmed to terminate.

Readability: Grouped the seven selectable industries as indented components under the NET to keep the table compact and scannable (9 rows total). No exclusion (question contains meaningful variance because 'None of the above' is an option).
tableId: s6a, action: labels - Cleaned row labels to match survey answer text (removed datamap prefixes). Added clearer questionText.
tableId: s6a, action: nets - Added multi-variable NET row (_NET_S6a_Any) combining S6ar1..S6ar8 (isNet=true, netComponents populated).
tableId: s6a, action: user_note - Added userNote '(Select all that apply.)' and baseText to indicate question was asked only of respondents who said they are Hispanic/Latino.
s7: Found in survey (S7: What is your race? Select all that apply). Updated questionText to full verbatim question.
s7: Cleaned row labels to match survey answer text (removed variable prefixes).
s7: Added a multi-variable NET row (_NET_S7_AnyRace) combining S7r1-S7r6 to show respondents who selected any race option (isNet with netComponents). Component rows indented beneath the NET.
s7: Marked table as derived (isDerived=true) because a synthetic NET row was added.
s7: Added userNote '(Select all that apply)'. No rows excluded.
labels: Shortened and cleaned each row label to match survey answer text (removed repeated question stem).
nets: Added two mean_rows NETs: On-premise (S9r5,S9r6,S9r7,S9r8,S9r9,S9r10,S9r11,S9r12,S9r13,S9r14,S9r16) and Off-premise (S9r1,S9r2,S9r3,S9r4,S9r15) to show aggregated on-/off-premise drink counts.
structure: Grouped component rows under their NETs (components indented) for readability and to keep the table scannable.
userNote/baseText: Added baseText and userNote to clarify who was asked and input requirements.
no_change: Kept table type as mean_rows and preserved all original variables (no variables removed).

a7_1: Found source question (A7). Cleaned and shortened row labels to match survey answer text; created a multi-variable NET '_NET_A7_AnySubstance' (netComponents: A7r1-A7r5) to report respondents who used any substance alongside the drink; indented component rows under the NET; left 'None of the above' as a standalone top-level row; added user note '(Select all that apply; asked for the current drink occasion)'. No exclusion.
a9_1: labels - cleaned up row labels to match survey text (removed trailing reminder text).
a9_1: nets - added synthetic multi-variable NET '_NET_AnyCompanion' aggregating A9r2-A9r7 to show respondents who were with any companion.
a9_1: userNote - added note to clarify select-all nature and mutual exclusivity of 'I was alone'.
labels: Cleaned and shortened row labels to match survey answer text (removed internal pipe placeholders).
nets: Added multi-variable NET row '_NET_A13b_AnyOther' aggregating A13br1-A13br5 (Any other drinks).
context: Added surveySection 'OCCASION LOOP', baseText indicating question was asked only of respondents who answered 'Yes' to A13a, and userNote '(Select all that apply)'.
readability: Kept table compact (NET + 5 component rows) and used indentation so components roll up into the NET.
a16_1: labels - Cleaned and shortened row labels to match survey wording; removed datamap piping text.
a16_1: nets - Added multi-variable NET '_NET_A16_AnyReason' combining A16r1..A16r10 to show percent selecting any reason. Marked component rows as indent:1 under the NET.
